result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nyzaire J Liggins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nyzaire J Liggins appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Nyzaire J Liggins.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has received all discovery and is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nyzaire J Liggins in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nyzaire J Liggins appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and no offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nyzaire J Liggins in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nyzaire J Liggins
Current: 10545 W Donna Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 07-19-2022)
Prior: 8869 West Appleton Avenue #6, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/19/22 @ 1p
